Buruh & Pengusaha Protes UMP 2020, Menaker: Kita Terus Dialog
01 Nov 2019, 06:19 by Marlinda Oktavia Erwanti


Menaker Ida Fauziyah/Foto: Ida Fauziyah (Andhika Prasetia/detikcom)

Jakarta - Pemerintah menetapkan UMP alias Upah Minimum Provinsi (UMP) 2020 naik 8,51%. Kebijakan ini membuat pengusaha dan buruh bersuara.Para buruh tidak puas kenaikan tersebut, mereka meminta UMP naik lagi hingga 15%. Di sisi lain pengusaha ada yang mengeluh kenaikannya terlalu besar.Lantas, apa respons Menteri Ketenagakerjaan Ida Fauziyah terhadap kondisi tersebut? "kita terus kembangkan dialog dengan mereka ya. Sebenarnya peraturan pemerintah ini kan lebih mengakomodasi dua-duanya,," tutur Ida di Istana Presiden, Jumat (1/11/2019).Selain itu, menurut Ida, skema pengupahan berdasarkan PP 78 tahun 2015 sudah berjalan dan sejauh diharapkan bisa diterima buruh maupun pengusaha. Skema upah minimum mengacu pada tingkat inflasi dan laju pertumbuhan ekonomi."Skema pengupahan ini kan sudah berjalan lima tahun ya, Jadi so far kita berharap diterima dengan baik, oleh pengusaha maupun buruh,"Ida menambahkan pemerintah mengedepankan dialog dengan pengusaha maupun buruh dalam menyelesaikan masalah UMP."Kita posisi di tengah. semua data diambil dari BPS, bukan diambil sendiri-sendiri, baik dari pengusaha maupun buruh. kita terus bangun dialog ya, apakah pengusaha atau buruh," tutur politikus PKB itu.Sebagai informasi kenaikan UMP 2020 sebesar 8,51% Kebijakan ini dicantumkan Surat Edaran Menteri Ketenagakerjaan (Menaker) No.B-M/308/HI.01.00/X/2019. Surat Edaran tersebut mengacu pada Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) 78 tahun 2015 tentang pengupahan.Simak Video "Asyik! UMP Tahun 2020 Naik 8,51%"[Gambas:Video 20detik](hns/eds)

Workers & Entrepreneurs Protest UMP 2020, Menaker: We Continue Dialogue
01 Nov 2019, 06:19 by Marlinda Oktavia Erwanti


Menaker Ida Fauziyah / Photo: Ida Fauziyah (Andhika Prasetia / detikcom)

Jakarta - The government set the UMP alias Provincial Minimum Wage (UMP) 2020 up 8.51%. This policy makes employers and workers speak up. The workers are not satisfied with the increase, they ask that the UMP increase again by 15%. On the other hand there are businesspeople who complain that the increase is too large. Then, what is the response of the Minister of Manpower Ida Fauziyah to these conditions? "We continue to develop dialogue with them. Actually, this government regulation better accommodates both ,," said Ida at the Presidential Palace, Friday (11/01/2019). In addition, according to Ida, wage schemes based on PP 78 of 2015 has been running and as far as is expected to be accepted by workers and employers. The minimum wage scheme refers to inflation rates and economic growth rates. "This wage scheme has been running for five years, so we hope that it will be well received by employers and workers," Ida added the government put forward dialogue with employers and workers in solving problems "We are in the middle position. All data is taken from BPS, not taken individually, both from employers and workers. We continue to build dialogue, whether employers or workers," said the PKB politician. As information on the UMP 2020 increase of 8 , 51% of this policy included a Circular of the Minister of Manpower (Menaker) No.BM/308/HI.01.00/X/2019. This circular refers to the Government Regulation (PP) 78 of 2015 concerning wages. Watch Video "Fun! UMP 2020 Increases 8.51%" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (hns / eds)
